model_overview.objective: Predict FOMC rate decisions (cut, hold, hike) with class probabilities
model_overview.approach: Multiclass classification using macroeconomic indicators, FOMC communications (NLP), and historical outcomes

macroeconomic: FRED indicators (CPI, unemployment, housing starts, GDP, consumer sentiment)
communications: NLP features: sentiment (VADER, FinBERT), TF-IDF, BERTopic

feature_importance.note: Values are normalized to sum to 1.0 and represent global feature importance.

model_training.hyperparameter_tuning: Grid Search CV across Random Forest, XGBoost, LightGBM, CatBoost

interpretability.drivers: Top features often include Consumer Sentiment, Housing Starts, CPI, GDP, and prior Fed Funds levels
visualizations: LIME local explanations for each prediction

output_explanation.format: For each decision, the model outputs class probabilities (cut/hold/hike)
supporting_information: Macro snapshot (CPI, unemployment, sentiment, housing starts)
Historical analogues (past decisions under similar conditions)
output_explanation.confidence: Probabilities are calibrated; high when a class is dominant, lower when uncertainty is high

challenges: Differences in release frequency of data (monthly/quarterly vs. daily)
limitations.note: Predictions are probabilistic and should be viewed as informed signals, not certainties.
